textos_fuente.text: Have you ever wanted to live and work in paradise? We have it waiting for you! | Every Miles A Memory Pat‚Äôs Facebook Cindy‚Äôs Facebook Blog Archive ‚ò∞ Navigation Every Miles A Memory Wandering Through the Camera Lens Home About Us Blog Past Blogs Galleries Contact Us Search for: Have you ever wanted to live and work in paradise? We have it waiting for you! Posted on May 23, 2015 by Pat Bonish in Cedar Key 46 Comments Cindy and I like to take things that don‚Äôt work too well and turn them into well-oiled machines. December of 2009 landed us in Cedar Key with a monumental task in front of us. Turn a run-down motel/rv park into something that people would actually want to visit. Along the way we built a Tiki Bar out of left over items washed up along the shore and bottles we put back with friends and visitors. Looking at it from the outside, you‚Äôd have thought it was impossible. But we like a serious challenge and accepted it with open arms. Cedar Key is a diamond in the rough and was the perfect location to allow our artistic talents to bloom. It took us over 5 years to accomplish our goal, and now that we‚Äôve brought it up to our standards, it‚Äôs time to move onto something more challenging. (We don‚Äôt know what that next challenge is yet, we‚Äôll have to go find it üôÇ ) Call us crazy, call us insane, call us stupid (We‚Äôve been called all of those time and time again) but don‚Äôt call us a couple that likes to sit still or isn‚Äôt up for a challenge. We tend to pull the rug out from under our own feet every 5-8 years and have done just that continuously since we‚Äôve met. Neither of us can figure out why we do these antics, but we keep doing them, and for us, it keeps life a never ending adventure. So with a very heavy heart and after weeks of second guessing ourselves, we‚Äôve put the Low-Key Hideaway on the real estate market. We‚Äôre selling it as a Turn-Key business‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ Motel/RV Park/Tiki Bar which includes the liquor license and our Subaru Outback Wagon for you to roll around town in. If you throw in a little bit more, you can have the houseboat. All you need to do is bring your ‚ÄòA‚Äô Game to Cedar Key, sit back and enjoy the good life. We‚Äôve done all the hard work for you. The rooms are 100% remodeled and kept up to date with top-notch furnishings, artwork and fixtures. Everything runs like a top, we‚Äôre not selling this to run away from anything, if we are to stay, it‚Äôll run this way for years to come. The business has earned numerous awards from Trip Advisor, been rated at the top for 5 years in a row, won business of the year from the Cedar Key Chamber of Commerce, been featured in numerous national and international travel magazines and articles‚Ä¶.you name it, we‚Äôve put it on a platter for you. We have a fully functioning Website that receives an enormous amount of traffic. We‚Äôre the top rated motel in Cedar Key. We have a very loyal customer base and we still have travel pieces waiting to be aired which will further strengthen our tourism presence. The Tiki Bar is an attraction of its own. It brings visitors from all around the country/world to bathe in the monumental sunsets it offers. It has loads of potential to grow‚Ä¶.for the right buyer, the sky is the limit (When you buy it, I will gladly tell you how I‚Äôd expand if I were to stay). We‚Äôve always kept it small simply because it‚Äôs only the 3 of us running the entire business. Bring on some more employees and you can grow to whatever your potential might be. If you want to live comfortably like we do, then stay this size and just sit back and ride the gravy train. We‚Äôve bought the empty piece of property beside us so your RV‚Äôs sites can be more than doubled. All the permitting and hard part has been done for you. What are you waiting for? Florida is booming right now and breaking records each year with its tourism numbers. We‚Äôve built your next business for you, come live and work in paradise. Please do not contact me for details. We have listed the property with Brad Smith whose contact info is listed below. Brad Smith Smith & Assoc. United Country Trenton Phone: 352-221-5256 / 352-463-7770 Email: contactus@ucsmith.com Such an Amazing Sunset with the SS Minnow as a foreground Subject Big Lightning Storm behind the Low-Key Hideaway Secret Garden Tags: Brad Smith , cedar key , Cedar Key Florida , Commercial Real Estate , For Sale , LKH , Low-Key Hideaway , Selling Florida About Pat Bonish Pat Bonish is a photographer, writer and lover of anything artistic.  He is married to the love of his life and works from home in Cedar Key Florida where they run a small Studio. The studio showcases their art, antiques and oddities all while operating as a full bar too View all posts by Pat Bonish ‚Üí Subscribe Subscribe to our e-mail newsletter to receive updates. We have it waiting for you!‚Äù

‚ÄòHe‚Äôs got such a big heart‚Äô: Community gives back to hospitalized Cedar Key business owner Skip to content Download Apps Newsletter Tell Us Something Good Be Our Guest Meet the Team Advertise with Us Submit Photos and Videos Watch Live Video News First Alert Weather Sports Features Hurricane HQ Telemundo Contact Us Community InvestigateTV Home Watch Live News Gainesville Ocala Lake City State National Crime Politics Education Health Good News Sponsored First Alert Weather Hurricane HQ 24/7 Live Weather Radar Weather Maps Forecast Graphics Tropics Graphics First Alert Explained Weather 101 Sports Florida Gators High School Scholar Athlete Russell Report TV20 Coaches Spotlight Junior College Chomp List Submit Your Sports Photos Espa√±ol Contact Us News Tips Meet the Team Download Our Apps Advertise Employment Advertise Features Bright Futures One Class at a Time Hometown Heroes Paige's Kitchen Tech Tuesday FL Man Adventures Adopt A Pet Wildlife Wednesday Fitness Community Community Calendar Contests TV20 Newsletter Sign-Up Submit Photos and Videos Tell Us Something Good Programming Schedule Zeam - News Streams Gray DC Bureau NextGen TV Zeam - News Streams InvestigateTV Watching Your Wallet Be Our Guest Sky20 Drone Your Local Chamber Your Local Experts HealthCARES Watch ABC Online PowerNation Circle Country Digital Marketing ‚ÄòHe‚Äôs got such a big heart‚Äô: Community gives back to hospitalized Cedar Key business owner ‚ÄòHe‚Äôs got such a big heart‚Äô: Community gives back to hospitalized Cedar Key business owner By Kayla Lewis Published : May 16, 2025 at 6:13 PM EDT Email This Link Share on Facebook Share on X (formerly Twitter) Share on Pinterest Share on LinkedIn CEDAR KEY, Fla. (WCJB) - Residents are rallying around one of their own as he undergoes many surgeries due to an unexpected complication during surgery. ‚ÄúI said what the hell man, you haven‚Äôt answered in a couple of days, and he said I‚Äôm in the hospital, I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôll be alive,‚Äò‚Äù shared business owner Patrick Bonish. That‚Äôs what the owner of the Lowkey Hideaway and Tiki Bar, Scott Larsen, told Bonish earlier this month when he ended up at the hospital after he felt like his stomach was going to burst, leaving all who know him praying for his recovery. ‚ÄúScott‚Äôs just an incredible person. He‚Äôs got such a big heart, and he cares so deeply for not only the people who work for him, but for everyone in this community,‚Äù said Laura Gregory, General Manager of Lowkey Hideaway and Tiki Bar. He had a small bowel obstruction and needed emergency surgery. However, his fianc√©e says that during surgery, his large intestine was accidentally punctured. They switched hospitals when they noticed a foul odor coming from his sutures. They believe this decision saved his life. ‚ÄúWhen you have a challenge, you break glass and you call in the marines. Well, Scott was kind of like that guy for the island. When the emergency dropped and the disaster hit, Scott did whatever it took to help the people on the island,‚Äù shared Cedar Key Mayor Jeff Webb. On Friday, May 16, he had his third surgery to fix the faulty connection between his intestines. During a devastating 2024 hurricane season, Larsen played a key role in helping others prepare their businesses as well as helping rebuild after. ‚ÄúOrganized volunteers and donations to help us get drywall in and installed, drywall mudded, and painted. I mean we would probably be months behind and a few thousand dollars more in debt,‚Äù shared Hannah Hoffman, owner of Prickly Palm. Larsen was instrumental in getting volunteers back onto the island to help with recovery efforts. ‚ÄúI mean helping everyone. It didn‚Äôt matter, never at any point asked who‚Äôs going to pay for this? How is this going to be done? He just made sure it got done,‚Äù Bonish said. Now, people in the community say they want to rally around him the same way he has for many others. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs incredible to have so much love and support coming in,‚Äù shared Carrie Sager, Larsen‚Äôs fianc√©e. Sager tells TV20 it‚Äôs unclear if he‚Äôll need more surgeries, but he should recover normally; it just might take some time. If you would like to donate to the GoFundMe to help with medical expenses and more, click here. Click here to subscribe to our newsletter. Copyright 2025 WCJB. All rights reserved.
